title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Act allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. Amendments include the inclusion of retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and the repeal of the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. Amendments to Veterans' Disability Compensation include removing certain subsections and redesignating others. Additionally, disability retirees with less than 20 years of service are now included in the benefits. Amendments to Veterans' Disability Compensation now include reducing retired pay for qualified retirees with less than 20 years of service under chapter 61 of title 38. Amendments to Veterans' Disability Compensation now include reducing retired pay for qualified retirees with less than 20 years of service under chapter 61 of title 38. Section 1414 allows for concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. The amendment allows for concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible veterans under chapter 61 of title 38. Members eligible for retired pay can now receive concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation. Section 1413a(f) is amended to reflect this change. The effective date for these amendments is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act. Combat-related special compensation eligibility expanded for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Combat-related special compensation eligibility expanded for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Amendments made to eligibility and computation criteria for retired pay. Combat-related special compensation eligibility expanded for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Payment under paragraph (1) reduced for retirees with fewer than 20 years of creditable service if retired pay exceeds a certain amount. The amendments expand combat-related special compensation eligibility for Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. Payments are reduced for retirees with fewer than 20 years of creditable service if their retired pay exceeds a specified amount. The effective date for these changes is the first day of the first month after the enactment of the Act and applies to payments starting from that date.
